1211111.content:
"Well, there's not much in my room that I think you would enjoy." Austin said as he looked around his room that was the nursery. "Maybe we should head downstairs and play a game or watch TV."

"Hold on, you mean that you only get changed in here and sleep?" Said Dez accusingly as he gave Austin a look. "If that's the case, then why are there baby toys and books scattered around the room?"

Austin blushed and started to tear up as he began to answer, "I...Well...Dez...You see...."

When Dez realized that he had hurt Austin's feelings, he said in a much softer voice, "It's ok buddy, I didn't mean to upset you. We don't have to talk about this now. We can talk when you feel ready to talk. Just remember, I'm here for you, because that's what bro's do." He once again gave Austin a tight hug and as Dez saw the corners of Austin's mouth turn slightly upwards to a smile, he said, "Come on, let's go downstairs and watch TV."

Austin agreed and as he began to lead the way down the stairs, he didn't notice Dez grab a pacifier on the way down.

When Dez grabbed the pacifier, he wasn't thinking of using it for himself. Instead, he figured that if Austin became upset, that it might calm him down. After all, that is what seemed to happen when Dez was changing him. As he headed downstairs, he heard his stomach rumble and realized that in his rush to return Austin's backpack, he had skipped supper. Turning to Austin, he said, "Bro, do you have anything to eat? I missed supper when I came over here."

Austin thought for a moment and said, "I don't think we do, but my parents did leave some money on the counter in case I woke up and was hungry. After all, they won't be home until late Sunday and the weekend is only just begun. Why don't we order a pizza or chinese takeout? Or we can get your parents to bring us something and you can stay here this weekend since you now know my secret."

Dez was still wanting to know more about Austin's feelings of being in diapers and decided that staying over for the weekend would be a good idea. "You know what, that is a good idea! I'll call my parents and get them to bring me clothes for the weekend and something to eat for us," said Dez as he picked up his phone. "Hey mom, could you or dad bring me clothes for the weekend? I'm going to stay with Austin since his parents are out of town for the weekend and we thought it would be fun to just hangout. Also, could you stop by and grab us a pizza and some soda? What does Austin want on the pizza? Hold on, I'll ask," said Dez as he turned to Austin. "What do you want on it? I was thinking an extra large peperoni pizza with extra cheese, some wings, and cokes."

Austin was salivating as Dez was talking about the food as he said, "sounds good to me! Just make sure you get some ranch dressing for the wings!"

Dez turned back to his phone and told his mom what they wanted and she was fine with it and said she would be there soon. When Dez hung up the phone, he looked at Austin and said, "bro, since my mom will be here soon, don't you think it might be best to throw on some extra clothing?"

Austin didn't understand and asked, "what are you taking about? I'm dressed fine." As he looked up and down himself, he caught onto what Dez was saying. "Oh, right, I gotcha. I need something else on to cover my diaper. Alright, I'll go throw some more cloths on." Austin stood up and began to walk towards the stairs when he heard Dez get up. As he looked over his shoulder, he saw Dez follow him up to his room. When they arrived, Austin finally couldn't take it anymore and asked, "Dez, what are you doing? I'm perfectly capable of putting something on."

Dez readily replied, "I know that. But Austin, I just found out my best friend no, practically my brother, wears diapers. If you don't think I'm curious, you're crazy." While looking into Austin's closet, Dez couldn't help himself and asked, "what do you normally wear over your diapers when you are home with just your parents?"

"Well," Austin said, "normally, I just wear my diaper and a t-shirt. Sometimes though, I wear one of these," as he pulled a few items out of his closet. One of them resembled a pair of overalls. "These are called coveralls. They have snaps near the crotch so that I can be changed without having to take it off. They also look similar to regular overalls so that if the mailman came up and I answered the door, he would never notice on first glance," he said. The other one looked like a really long t-shirt that came to a sort of point. "This is called a onesie. Basically, it is what it looks like. It's a long t-shirt type of clothing that snaps together at the crotch. It is like the coveralls. It is meant to be easier to change me. I actually wear these to school sometimes. When it's tucked into my pants, and I have an over shirt on as well, nobody notices," Austin said matter of factly.

"WHAT!" Dez exclaimed in shock. "You mean you've worn one of these onesie's to school and got away with it! That's crazy!"

"Not really," replied Austin. "They do make it easier when I need to be changed."

"Well in that case, let's just put this one on you," said Dez as he started to pull a onesie over Austin's head.

"Wait, what are you doing!" cried out Austin. " I don't need to wear my onesie now."

Dez ignored Austin's pleas and finished pulling the onesie down and snapping it at the crotch. "There. That's better, now lets find a pair of gym shorts for you to pull on," said Dez as he scrambled around Austin's room and found a pair for him. He held them out and said, "come on Austin, step in. It won't be long before my mom gets here with my clothes and the pizza."

Austin glared at Dez as he was helped into his gym shorts. "Dez, I'm not a little kid, I can do this myself," Austin pouted. "Why did you put me into a onesie anyway?"

"I know you're not a little kid bro, I'm just trying to help you out. Plus, you said that the onsie made it easier to change you when you needed to be," Dez said. "Come on, lets head back downstairs, I think I see my mom's headlights."

12111111.content:
As they were heading downstairs, Dez heard a car door slam and heard a knocking on the door. "It's open mom," he said before Austin got the chance. "Thanks for bringing everything by. I'll see you Sunday night!"

As Dez's mom left and the boys sat the food down in the living room to eat while watching TV, Dez pulled Austin's gym shorts down and tossed them into the laundry room. "There, that should be slightly more comfortable. Well, am I right Austin?" Dez asked.

"Yeah, having the gym shorts on did make everything tight in my diaper area," Austin agreed. "Anyway, let's eat! I'm starving!"

Forty-five (45) minutes later the boys had just finished the last of the pizza and wings. They both agreed that it was delicious and that they had eaten entirely too much food, but hey, they're teenagers. Isn't the definition of being a teenage boy being messy, hungry all of the time, and lazy?

"Let's find something to watch on TV," Austin said. "Hey, what about that Top Gear?" Austin asked excitedly.

Dez knew Austin loved Top Gear, and agreed. "Yeah, that's fine with me." About twenty (20) minutes or so into the show, Dez noticed Austin fidgeting a little bit and saw his eyes lose focus. He didn't think anything of it until right around the time the show ended. As the credits rolled, Dez thought he smelt something in the air. At first he passed it off as a bit of gas, however, when the smell lingered, he had a bit of a grimace on his face. "Austin," Dez asked.

"Yeah, what's up," questioned Austin who was still watching the TV.

"Come here for a second," said Dez. After Austin got up and walked over to Dez, he saw Dez unsnap the crotch snaps of his onesie and was turned around. As Dez pulled the back of Austin's diaper out and checked him in front as well, he sighed. "Yeah, that's what I thought, you have a dirty diaper. I saw you fidgeting earlier during the show Austin, why didn't you tell me you were messing your diaper, or that you needed to be put on the potty" Dez asked.

"I wasn't fidgeting, and I don't know what you're talking about!" said Austin.

"Yes you were!" replied Dez. "I saw you sit there, fidget, and I'm just guessing here, but while you were fidgeting, you filled the back of your diaper!" Dez said as he raised his voice.

Austin didn't know what to say. He put pressure on the back of his diaper, and sure enough, he had messed. Finally, he said, "Dez, I told you earlier, my parent's didn't potty train me. I don't know when I'm wetting or messing. It just happens. This is something I go through every day. I guess my body fidgeted to help the process along." After a few minutes of silence, Austin sat back down with tears forming in his eyes. He was a smelly mess and his best friend was upset with him.

Dez watched Austin sit back down and said in a softer voice, "bro, I'm not mad, I forgot what you had told me earlier. I'm sorry." As he fumbled around in his pocket, he felt the pacifier. He gently pushed it into Austin's mouth and said, "let's go get you changed little bro."

When Austin took Dez's hand, he was lead upstairs to his nursery. As Dez helped Austin onto the teen sensation's changing table and Austin went into something akin to a trance. As Dez untapped the diaper, he almost gagged. Austin had really done a number on that diaper. Luckily, Austin was so absorbed into his pacifier, that he didn't notice. As Dez began the process of cleaning the mess off of Austin, he noticed the pop sensation becoming aroused. As Dez pulled Austin away from the little trance he was in, he said, "bro, there's something you might want to take care of," motioning to his pelvic region.

"Oh, right," said Austin, embarrassed.

"It's nothing to be embarrassed about, we all have it happen. I'm going to stop this change and tape your diaper back up so you can take care of this," said Dez. "I'm going to leave for just a minute and will be right back. I'll give you enough time to take care of your problem." After that was said, Dez stepped out of the room and let Austin do his thing. Shortly thereafter, he walked back in and saw Austin flipped over and slightly sprawled out on the changing table with the pacifier back in his mouth. Dez smiled to himself, flipped Austin back the correct way, and resumed his diaper change.

Once Austin was re-diapered, Dez glanced at his watch and noticed it was around 10pm. Normally, he would stay up until at least midnight, but tonight, he decided that Austin was tired and went ahead and put him to bed. He also decided to head to bed. Unsure of where to sleep, since he had put Austin in his crib, he just crashed on the small pull down bed that was in the nursery. Shortly after crawling into bed, he heard Austin softly snoring. Dez smiled to himself again as he thought about the day's events. Never in his wildest dreams did he imagine that his best friend, and teen pop sensation Austin Moon, would wear diapers, and seem to enjoy being treated like a little kid. He also never thought that he would enjoy acting as a big brother to Austin. He didn't realize that he had that protective instinct. These were among the many thoughts going through Dez's mind as he drifted off to sleep.

"DEZ!!!" With a jolt Dez jumped out of bed. As he scanned the room he saw Austin sitting up in his crib. He looked at his watch and to his astonishment, it was only 7:30am. "What's happening?" Dez asked. He was wide-eyed looking for trouble. When he realized that there was none, he said, "Austin, it's only 7:30 in the morning! We shouldn't be up until Noon."

Austin looked at Dez and just said, "you wouldn't wake up when I quietly called your name. I had to scream to wake you up."

"Well," said Dez, "what do you need?"

"My diaper needs to be changed," Austin said with a blank stare.

"Ooookkkk, get on the changing table bro, and I'll take care of it," Dez yawned as he got up and stretched. Noticing that Austin was still in his crib, he had a revelation and remembered that Austin couldn't climb out of his own crib and needed to be let out of it. So, he did just that.

As Austin hopped up on the changing table, he automatically assumed the position. He warned Dez before Dez started to change him that it was a disaster.

"Aw come off it, it can't be that bad," Dez laughed as he untapped the diaper.

"Don't say I didn't warn you," Austin cautioned.

Once Dez had the diaper untapped, he had to agree with Austin. In addition to the diaper being soaked, Austin must have messed during the night. Deciding that this diaper was too much for the changing table, he re-diapered Austin, helped him off the table, and took him to the bathroom. "Alright," he told Austin, "I'm going to untape your dirty diaper and I want you to stand in the shower. After that, I'll clean you off."

Austin pondered for a second and asked, "Dez, do you want to just hop in the shower with me. After all, I realize how dirty this diaper is, and you'll be messy by the time you finish cleaning me. Plus, you have to get clean sometime. No homo, just common sense."

Dez thought it over and said laughing, "sure why not, but no homo!" Dez undressed and got in the shower after removing Austin's diaper and putting it in the diaper pail. A short time later, both were clean. After drying Austin and himself off, Dez, concerned that Austin might have an accident or leak on the way back to his room, sat Austin on the toilet and told him to point his member down into the bowl, just in case. After getting the diapering supplies, a onesie, and Austin's trusty pacifier, Dez pulled him off of the toilet and had him re-diapered and dressed and Austin was happily sucking away on his pacifier. Dez couldn't help but notice how cute that was.

A short time later after both had eaten and were relaxing out by the pool, Dez felt it was safe to breach a question he still didn't have answered. "Hey, Austin," Des started.

"Yeah, what's up?" replied Austin.

"You never answered my question (referring to the question asked in the previous chapter of the story). Do you enjoy all of the baby treatment you get? I mean, come on, you sleep in a nursery, wear diapers 24/7 and get changed on a changing table, and have an addiction to your pacifier," Dez stated.

"Well," Austin started to say, "I do somewhat. I enjoy the feelings of being cared for and the loving touch when someone changes my diapers. I also, clearly, enjoy my pacifier. I could do without the nursery, crib, baby toys, the coveralls, and baby books. Although, it is nice to sometimes just let everything go and be a baby, but I could totally do without that."

Dez thought for a moment and said, "I see. So, if I were to ask if you wanted to be a full time baby, or at least explore more of your little side more you would say......." as he left the statement hanging.

"I would say.......................

121111111.content:
"I would say no," Austin said. "It's like I said, I enjoy some aspects of this, but I'm happy exactly where I'm at. In the future though, who knows. I've actually been giving some thought as to being potty trained. However, to embark on an endeavor like that with my musical and school career would be daunting. I would need to be watched constantly, and placed on the potty at a moments notice. I couldn't do that without revealing myself to Ally, Trish, everyone at school, and the world. It would be like in the middle of a concert, I suddenly have to go pee or poo and have to have someone come explain to my fans that I had to take a break while someone helps me go potty. It's humiliating."

"Wow, you're serious aren't you?" asked Dez. "I just thought it might be good for you to have both. Like be potty trained, but have control where and when you fill your diapers. That way, your parents still have a baby to change, you still get the loving feeling, and you have some independence. Anyway, if and when you feel up to it, I'll gladly help potty train you bro!" exclaimed Dez, not realizing just how corny that sounded.

Austin laughed while he said, "like I say though, that's in the future, and I would have to talk my parents into it as well. No, I think I'm fine where I'm at for now."

"I understand." said Dez as he stood up. "Man, it's hot out here, let's go for a swim!"

"Sure thing, I could use a change. This diaper is soaked. And i'll need to be put into my swim diaper." Austin stated.

As Dez just blankly stared at him, Austin added, "it lets me swim. If I was in my diaper, it would explode from the water being let in."

When they got to his room, Austin went and got his sleep diaper and handed it to Dez.

"This is it?" questioned Dez. "It doesn't look like it'll absorb anything when you wet it."

"Well....it's not really designed to hold water...." Austin mumbled, still uncomfortable talking about his bodily functions with his best friend.

"What's it made for then?" Dez asked, confused. That was the one thing Austin never got about Dez, how he was just so dense.

"Sigh, come on Dez, don't make me spell it out for you," Austin grumbled. As Austin saw the dumb look on Dez's face he said, "It's for when I mess. It keeps it out of the pool. Water is easily filtered, other...things aren't.

"Ooohhhh," Dez said flatly. "Gotcha. Moving on, hop up on your changing table bro. Let's get you out of your cold wet diaper and into your swim diaper so we can have some fun!"

They were quickly outside and in the water, jumping off the diving board, playing Marco Polo, water ball, and more. They were talking about girls they thought were hot when Dez noticed Austin's eyes lose focus his conversation fade out and he fidgeted a bit. After a few seconds, he resumed the conversation. Not bothering to ask permission, Dez hopped off of his float and swam over to Austin's and had him lift a leg as he pulled on the leak guard a bit. Dez mentioned nonchalantly, "you messed your diaper again Austin," and got back on his float.

Austin, confused, asked, "aren't you going to change me? Hello, dirty diaper central and everything."

Dez looked over an said, "you'll be fine for a little while. Why don't we continue to have fun for 45 minutes or so? It's not like we're going anywhere."

Austin reluctantly agreed and the two resumed talking about girls and sports. They did swim a bit more until Austin, not thinking, did a cannonball while wearing the dirty diaper. While nothing spilled, Dez decided it was time to end the swim.

Since they both would have to take a shower before going back inside, Dez just quickly cleaned Austin off in the shower, let him have his...fun... and then took his shower.

After Dez had re-diapered Austin and put him in a onesie, they went back downstairs to watch TV. When flicking through the channels, they saw that school had been canceled for the week due to bad weather moving in. Almost as soon as they saw that, Austin got a phone call from his parents saying that their flight had been canceled because of the weather, and that they wouldn't be home for another week. His parents transferred money to his bank account so that he was fine for the week. Dez called his parents and said he was going to stay with Austin since otherwise, he would be by himself for a week with bad weather. They also transferred money to his account.

When the boys saw that they were going to need food, they had a taxi come get them and they went shopping. "Hey Dez, do you think we'll need any veggies this week?" Austin asked.

"No, I'm thinking chips, sandwiches, pizzas, ice cream, sodas, and junk food." laughed Dez. "What about you Austin? Do you need anything?

"I agree with you, and I'm stocked up on diapers, powder, and wipes, so I should be ok." Austin said.

After they got back to Austin's house and unpacked their food, Dez decided it was time for a nap. " I'll tell you what Austin, since it's just us for the week, I'll let you out of the crib to sleep. And since I'm definitely not sleeping on that baby sized pull out bed, I guess we will share your parents bed." Dez told Austin.

Austin excitedly agreed. Knowing how Dez was however, he threw out a "It's cool, but no dutch ovens!"

Dez laughingly agreed but threw out his own joke, "coming from the pop sensation who runs around in messy diapers! Sure, I'll try not to ruin your first experience in a real bed."

After they had both settled down, and Austin had been tucked in to prevent him from rolling off since he was used to bars on a his crib, Dez hit the light and jumped into bed. As he heard Austin snoring on the far end of the bed, he still couldn't believe all that had happened over 2 days. He fell asleep thinking that he was glad to be helping Austin through the trials and tribulations of his life. Who knows, he may even wind up potty training his best friend.

132.content: Dez was excited. He finally had the funds to produce the his own movie. The movie was gong to be all about a boy who was bullied and was completely his own idea. Not only that, but he himself was going to play the bully! And thank to a Promise made a long time ago, Austin was going to have to be the victim. 132.title: Dez

choices: force Austin's character to pee himself
Give Austin's character a wedgie
Other
1321.content:
Dez POV

I'm usually pumped full of energy but today I was extra pumped full of energy. I finally got my chance to complete my dream project. Ever since I held my first camcorder I knew I didn't just want to film family moments but to direct a movie. Not just any movie, but a movie written, stared and directed by me. I just couldn't control my excitement. I got everything I needed to make my film. Though it was a short film I was not deterred to make it any less than perfect.With my friend Austin acting in it how could it be anything but perfect, it was gonna rock. I got the location and everything ready for the first shoot of my film, "The Bully I love to Hate." The title was a stroke of genius. All that was left for me to do was go and pick Austin up.


Austin POV
My alarm kept buzzing even after I was well sort of awake. I wanted nothing more than to hit the snooze button and sink back under my covers into a deep sleep, almost a hibernation like bears. I just had to promise Dez that I'd act in his movie. I thought nothing of it at the time, Dez always gets strange and quirky ideas all the time but none of them ever pan out. Guess there's a first time for everything. Man today is starting out weird already I'm talking to myself. Well as long as I don't answer. I noticed the time and freaked. Dez would be here any minute and I'm still in my boxers. No time for a fresh pair of underwear, I threw together an outfit I left on the floor from the day before. A simple black shirt and blue basketball shorts would have to do. No sooner I got my shoes on I heard Dez's signature knock at my door. I ran out the door and was greeted by Dez's infectious smile. Even though I was still reluctant and worried about his movie Dez's smile always put me at ease. "Hey Austin, you ready to make movie magic?" He asked me chipper as ever. He was so energetic I couldn't help but feel the same. " Whatever you say Dez, I did promise after all." I said as we headed out. "Dez hold up who is that?" I asked noticing a strange looking man waiting in a red sports car. "Oh him that's victor he's gonna drive us to the set." Dez said as he pushed me towards the car. The man identified as Victor opened the rear door and ushered me in. Dez sat shotgun. He looked back at me and said, "I know normally you ride shotgun, but I am the director after all." We both looked at each other and laughed. "I guess your right, mister director." I said jokingly. "Show some respect!" Victor shouted glaring at me from the rear view window. "It was a joke, meant to be funny." I said a little unnerved at being yelled at like that. "it's cool Victor." Dez said easing the tension in the car. "Sorry sir." Victor said in a more respectful tone than the one he used to rail me. "Austin man, I hired Victor here to be my driver so he's super strict on respect." Dez said as he noticed the hurt in my eyes. I nodded my head in understanding. I had bodyguards during some of my concerts who corrected fans when they treated me with anything but respect. "I'm sorry Victor." I apologized but Victor remained silent. We finally arrived, and Victor helped Dez out of the car I was chopped liver as I had to help myself out. Victor than drove off leaving us in God knows where. The place was really remote even more so than Dez led me to believe. In the middle of the barren wasteland, there was what appeared to be a school, and a neighborhood across from it, but what was weird is that it seem lifeless almost like a ghost town. "How do you like my set?" Dez asked. "Um what's your movie about? Is it a horror film?" I asked, I than realized I had agreed to act in a movie I had no idea what kind of movie it was. Dez then explained to me that he was gonna play the bully and I was gonna be his victim. "Sorry to bring this up but how are you gonna make a movie with just the two of us?" I asked noticing the distinct lack of actors and a film crew. "Bro it's all taken care of. See there is this new software where after we finish shooting I can splice in all the other actors scenes I shot months ago." He replied. "Wait you filmed some scenes already? Won't I be lost?" I asked surprised that Dez had began filming already. "Act one take one!" Dez scared me when he yelled that out. Unexpectedly while I was trying to regain my composure from my scare Dez punched me hard in the stomach. The pain brought me to my knees. "Who told you you could walk in my presence? I'm gonna beat the crap out of you!" He yelled as he began kicking me while I was on the floor. I did my best to cover my body from his kicks. "Dez stop please!' I cried. "Cut!" Dez yelled. "Austin dude I'm not Dez I'm Mark the bully and that makes you Chris the victim." He said as he helped me up to my feet. "If that was the case than why on earth did you really beat me?" I asked as I rubbed my sore body and wiped the blood from my face. Dez didn't answer instead he stayed silent, finally he broke the silence and told me, "It has to look believable, I want my movie to rock!" He exclaimed. I need a break I told him as I headed inside the set of the school.

Dez POV

I couldn't believe he would just call it quits after only not even a day. I was busy packing up my equipment no longer feeling energetic, I felt sad. I really wanted to make this movie work. "Hey Dez I'm sorry, just go easy on the hitting, I know you want to make it look real, but I don't handle pain well." He said. "Hey Austin don't sweat it bro, let's take five and than we can do the next scene the humiliation scene" I told him. The look of fear and confusion on his face was priceless. We hugged it out to symbolize no hard feelings and that after we ate we could resume the movie. I was excited about the next scene I the bully that is got to
1321.title: Movie Magic
